alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Catawba; Greater Caldwell; Iredell (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL CATAWBA... ALEXANDER...NORTHWESTERN IREDELL AND SOUTHEASTERN CALDWELL COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles north of Hickory, or near Bethlehem, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Taylorsville, Hickory, St. Stephens, Granite Falls, Bethlehem, Stony Point, Rhodhiss, Lake Hickory, and Lookout Shoals Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
